pageContext.claim: “ We're really acting more as a law enforcement agency [in Afghanistan] than we are as a military, because we could win that very quickly and easily if I was willing to kill millions of people. I'm not willing to do that. I'm not willing to do that. We'd win that so quickly your head would spin. And I'm not talking about nuclear; I'm talking about very conventional. But I'm not willing to kill millions of people.”
pageContext.analysis: There is little evidence that a massive conventional attack on Afghanistan, resulting in the deaths of millions of people, would lead to any victory. The U.S. has had a presence in Afghanistan for 18 years. Trump’s suggestion would wipe out one-third of the Afghani population, which would be a shocking and unprecedented world event indistinguishable from genocide. Still, there’s no guarantee that such an extreme move would ultimately lead to a stable Afghanistan.
